class_notes:
(Same as AAS 303 1)
(Black Music is an interdisciplinary course exploring critical perspectives on African Diasporic music, performance, and culture in the US and abroad. We will build a critique of cultural production emphasizing an intersectional framework and critique of oppression via black studies, black feminisms, and queer theory. This class will bring together various media, social science, film, and art as we discuss legacies of blues, funk, hip hop, and techno. We will work toward a broad definition of black music to consider its history and global implications.)
course_description: This course considers the idea of Black Music. What is it? What does it sound like?  Who created it? These musical questions are set in the context of an equally complicated web of ideas about race and the relationship between racial expectation and black music/cultural production.
schedule_location: TTh 1pm-2:15pm in New Psyc Bldg 220 (36 Eagle Ro
